alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 30 at 11:57PM AKDT until October 31 at 1:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 4 inches. Storm total snowfall since Saturday night of 8 to 18 inches, heaviest west of Tok. * WHERE...Along the Alaska Highway. * WHEN...Until 1 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Heavy snow will make travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow started Saturday night and continued through Sunday. Snow will continue into Monday and then taper off Monday afternoon. The heaviest snow is west of Tok, where both Tanacross and Robertson River will have nearly 18 inches of snow by Monday afternoon. There area from Tok to the the Canadian Border will have 8 to 12 inches of snow by Monday afternoon. Snow will taper off Monday afternoon.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
